item.title: Week 1: Jupyter Desktop Lab Bench
item.description: üëãüèª Hi! Let’s do some coding. The interface below accepts python code (it might take a moment to load up; if you can see a ‘play’ etc it’s loaded). Try copying and pasting this: text = "Oh yeah, digital archaeology!" print(text) into the gray box at the bottom of the interface below. Then, hit shift+enter while your cursor is in the box: Now try this: one = 1 two = 2 print(one + two) See how easy that was?

item.title: Week 3: Adding the R language to Jupyter Desktop
item.description: Student Instructions: Adding R to JupyterLab You can copy and paste this guide into your course materials. This guide will walk you through adding the R programming language as an option in your JupyterLab Desktop application. Part A: Install the R Language First, you need to install R itself. This is a separate application from JupyterLab. Go to the official R download site for your operating system: Windows: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/ Click the large “Download R-X.
